API¶

Main file¶

api.py mainly manages collects all the branches of the API that we wrote. It also defines an errorhandler, and a function to return a user’s hashed password, and a function to return a user’s type. Uses UTF-8 encoding

cloud.api.api.get_user(user_type, username)[source]¶

This returns a user entry from the database given their name and type. Parameters:

username: The username user_type: The user type, e.g. engineer

cloud.api.api.get_user_info()[source]¶

This returns a user’s hashed password.

cloud.api.api.page_not_found(e)[source]¶

This errorhandler passes the error text defined here whenever a user gets a 404 page not found error

Backlog API¶

backlogAPI.py defines the backlog API, whcih handles requests for engineers to repair cars.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.close_backlog()[source]¶

This closes an engineering backlog task as complete. Parameters:

signed_engineer_id: The ID of the engineer responsible for this repair car_id: The car that was just repaired

The function will return Success if all parameters are valid, and Fail if not.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.create_backlog()[source]¶

This function creates a new engineering backlog entry. Parameters:

assigned_engineer_id: The ID of the engineer responsible for this task car_id: The car the engineer is assigned to repair status: The status of the car. Needs to be set to Repair description: Description of repairs required

If all parameters are present and valid, the function returns Success, otherwise it returns Fail

cloud.api.backlogAPI.get_all_backlogs()[source]¶

Returns a JSON object of all engineering backlog tasks. No parameters required.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.get_backlogs_data()[source]¶

Returns a JSON object of all car id and its occurances. No parameters required.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.get_engineer_id()[source]¶

Returns the ID of the engineer assigned to repair a particular car. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question.

Returns the engineer ID if there is an open task for that car, otherwise will return No engineer found.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.remove_assigned_engineer_from_backlogs()[source]¶

Unassigns a particular assigned engineer from their tasks. Parameters:

id: The ID of the assigned engineer.

Returns Success if there were tasks to remove the given engineer from, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.remove_car_from_backlogs()[source]¶

Remove a particular car from all engineering backlogs. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question.

Returns Success if any records were found and updated, Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.backlogAPI.remove_signed_engineer_from_backlogs()[source]¶

Unassigns a particular assigned engineer from their tasks. Parameters:

id: The ID of the signed engineer.

Returns Success if there were tasks to remove the given engineer from, and Fail otherwise.

Booking API¶

bookingAPI.py defines the backlog API, whcih handles requests for engineers to repair cars.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.add_calendar_booking()[source]¶

Update the booking with the calendar ID.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.create()[source]¶

This function creates a new booking. Parameters:

customer_id: The ID of the customer making the booking car_id: the ID of the car being booked rent_time: The datetime where the user will start renting the car return_time: The datetime where the user is supposed to return the car total_cost: The expected total invoice for the rental during this period

The function returns Success if a new record is created, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_all_customer_bookings()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of all bookings for a given customer and car. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question customer_id: The customer in question

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_bookings_data()[source]¶

Returns the profit data by car id

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_customer_bookings_by_time()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of all bookings for a given customer and car, for a given time period. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question customer_id: The customer in question start: The datetime to start the search period end: the datetime to end the search period

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_longest_duration()[source]¶

Return a list of the longest signle booking for each car, organized by car. No parameters required.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_most_profit()[source]¶

Returns the most profitable car by day as a list. No parameters required.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.get_profit_data()[source]¶

Returns the profit data by date.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.read()[source]¶

Returns any bookings for a given car and user that should be active presently, e.g. where the customer is presently in the car. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question customer_id: the customer in question

Returns a dictionary of bookings. The results can be empty.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.read_last_record()[source]¶

Returns the last booking that the user has just booked, in order to save the calendar id back to the record. Parameters:

car_id: the car id customer_id: the customer id rent_time: rent_time

cloud.api.bookingAPI.read_record()[source]¶

Returns a booking by id. Parameters:

id: the booking id

cloud.api.bookingAPI.remove_car_from_bookings()[source]¶

Removes a car from all bookings. Parameters:

car_id: The car in question

Returns Success if any records were changed, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.remove_customer_from_bookings()[source]¶

Removes a customer from all bookings. Parameters:

customer_id: The customer in question

Returns Success if any records were changed, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.update()[source]¶

Updates the status of a booking, e.g. to indicate the customer has unlocked the car. Parameters:

status: The new status for the booking

Returns Success if a record was updated, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.bookingAPI.update_passed_bookings()[source]¶

Cancell of the booking that were in the the pass. No parameteres required.

Car API¶

carAPI.py defines all the functions regarding CRUD on cars, as well as a car’s booking history

cloud.api.carAPI.create()[source]¶

This creates a new car. Parameters:

mac_address: The MAC address of the car’s agent Pi brand: The brand of the car e.g. Honda type: The make of the car, e.g. Civic location_id: The location of the car status: Whether the car requires repairs, is booked, or available color: The color of the car. We use a list of colors in the UI but Other is an option. seat: How many seats there are in the car cost: The hourly cost of renting the car

Returns Done or an error

cloud.api.carAPI.delete_car()[source]¶

Deletes a car. Parameters:

car_id: The car to delete

Returns Success if a record was deleted, Fail otherwise

cloud.api.carAPI.get_available_car()[source]¶

Gets only cars available for booking during a certian time period. Parameters are the same as read() except:

start: The start time a customer wants to book for end: The time a customer wants to return the car

Returns a dictionary of cars that match the search criteria.

cloud.api.carAPI.get_car_history()[source]¶

Returns the booking history of a car. Parameters:

id: the id of the car in question

Returns the booking history of the car as a dictionary

cloud.api.carAPI.get_car_id_by_mac_address()[source]¶

Gets a car ID given the MAC address of its installed agent Pi. Parameters:

mac_address: The mac address of the agent Pi

Returns No car found if no results were found. Otherwise, returns the id of a car.

cloud.api.carAPI.read()[source]¶

This searches for a cars mathing a set of criteria. Parameters:

mac_address: The MAC address of the car’s agent Pi brand: The brand of the car e.g. Honda type: The make of the car, e.g. Civic location_id: The location of the car status: Whether the car requires repairs, is booked, or available color: The color of the car. We use a list of colors in the UI but Other is an option. seat: How many seats there are in the car cost: The hourly cost of renting the car

Returns a dictionary containing cars that match the search criteria

cloud.api.carAPI.update()[source]¶

Updates a car. Functions the same as create()

Customer API¶

customerAPI.py handles CRUD on customer users, and also a check if a given username exists.

cloud.api.customerAPI.check_username()[source]¶

Checks if a username exists. Parameters:

username: the username of the user

Returns 0 if the username does not exist, otherwise returns a count of the number of users with that name. Should never exceed 1.

cloud.api.customerAPI.create()[source]¶

Creates a customer. Parameters:

username: The username requested password: The user’s requested password. Will be SHA256 hashed before storing. first_name: The user’s first name last_name: The user’s last name email: The user’s email address. Validated elsewhere by regex. phone: The user’s phone number

Returns Success if an entry is created, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.customerAPI.delete()[source]¶

Deletes a user. Parameters:

id: The user id of the user to delete.

Returns Success if an entry was deleted, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.customerAPI.get_id()[source]¶

Gets a user’s id given their username. Parameters:

username: The username of the user

Returns invalid if no users found, or the user ID of the first result (there should only ever be one) otherwise.

cloud.api.customerAPI.read()[source]¶

Searches for all customer users that match a set of criteria. Parameters: id: The user’s id username: The user’s username first_name: The user’s first name last_name: The user’s last name email: The user’s email address. Validated elsewhere by regex. phone: The user’s phone number

Returns a dictionary containing all matches.

cloud.api.customerAPI.update()[source]¶

Updates a user. Functions exactly like create()

Location API¶

locationAPI.py contains only a function to return details on a given location.

cloud.api.locationAPI.get_location()[source]¶

This returns details (e.g. latitude, longitude) of a defined location. Parameters:

id: The id of the location in question

Returns a dictionary with the location details.

Staff API¶

staffAPI.py handles CRUD on staff users, and also a check if a given username exists.

cloud.api.staffAPI.check_username()[source]¶

Check if a username exists.

username: the user’s username

cloud.api.staffAPI.delete()[source]¶

Deletes a staff. Parameters:

id: The user id of the user to delete.

Returns Success if an entry was deleted, and Fail otherwise.

cloud.api.staffAPI.get_engineer_mac_address()[source]¶

Get engineer mac address. Parameters:

id: the engineer’s id

cloud.api.staffAPI.read()[source]¶

Searches for all staff users that match a set of criteria. Parameters: id: The user’s id username: The user’s username first_name: The user’s first name last_name: The user’s last name email: The user’s email address. Validated elsewhere by regex. phone: The user’s phone number user_type: The user’s user type

Returns a dictionary containing all matches.

cloud.api.staffAPI.update()[source]¶

Updates a user. Parameters:

username: The username requested password: The user’s requested password. Will be SHA256 hashed before storing. first_name: The user’s first name last_name: The user’s last name email: The user’s email address. Validated elsewhere by regex. phone: The user’s phone number engineer mac address: The user’s mac address

Returns Success if the entry is updated, and Fail otherwise.
